Bauduin Raphael wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> I am running several different test suites with the same TestResult
> object to collect the results:
> 
> suite(maxId).run(myTestResult);         
> 
> I now want to print the content if the TestResult object, but can't get
> it running (junit 3.8.1) with
> 
>         junit.textui.TestRunner myTestRunner = new 
> junit.textui.TestRunner();
>         myTestRunner.printFailures(myTestResult);      
> 
> I thought this would work, but I get
> 
> TestDatabaseMigration.java:32: cannot resolve symbol
> symbol  : method printFailures (junit.framework.TestResult)
> location: class junit.textui.TestRunner
>         myTestRunner.printFailures(myTestResult);
> 
> 
> I'm sure I must have missed something obvious, but I can't seem to find 
> it :(

Apparently there is no method "printFailures(TestResult)" on class 
TestRunner. I think the compiler message is pretty clear, don't you?
